segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 Release Notes
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 Release Notes

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 Release Notes
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 Release Notes

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 Release Notes
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 Release Notes

segment.source: To search Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 release notes, press Ctrl+F.
segment.target: To search Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 release notes, press Ctrl+F.

segment.source: You should read these release notes thoroughly before you install UE-V.
segment.target: You should read these release notes thoroughly before you install UE-V.

segment.source: The release notes contain information that is required to successfully install User Experience Virtualization, and contain additional information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: The release notes contain information that is required to successfully install User Experience Virtualization, and contain additional information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there are differences between these release notes and other UE-V documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there are differences between these release notes and other UE-V documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.
segment.target: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.

segment.source: Providing feedback
segment.target: Providing feedback

segment.source: Tell us what you think about our documentation for MDOP by giving us your feedback and comments.
segment.target: Tell us what you think about our documentation for MDOP by giving us your feedback and comments.

segment.source: Send your documentation feedback to mdopdocs@microsoft.com.
segment.target: Send your documentation feedback to mdopdocs@microsoft.com.

segment.source: UE-V known issues
segment.target: UE-V known issues

segment.source: This section contains release notes for User Experience Virtualization.
segment.target: This section contains release notes for User Experience Virtualization.

segment.source: Registry settings do not synchronize between App-V and native applications on the same computer
segment.target: Registry settings do not synchronize between App-V and native applications on the same computer

segment.source: When a computer has an application that is installed through both Application Virtualization (App-V) and a locally with a Windows Installer (.msi) file, the registry-based settings do not synchronize between the technologies.
segment.target: When a computer has an application that is installed through both Application Virtualization (App-V) and a locally with a Windows Installer (.msi) file, the registry-based settings do not synchronize between the technologies.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: To resolve this problem, run the application by selecting one of the two technologies, but not both.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: To resolve this problem, run the application by selecting one of the two technologies, but not both.

segment.source: Settings do not synchronization when network share is outside user’s domain
segment.target: Settings do not synchronization when network share is outside user’s domain

segment.source: When Windows® 8 attempts operating system settings synchronization, the synchronization fails with the following error message: boost::filesystem::exists::Incorrect user name or password.
segment.target: When Windows® 8 attempts operating system settings synchronization, the synchronization fails with the following error message: boost::filesystem::exists::Incorrect user name or password.

segment.source: This error can indicate that the network share is outside the user’s domain or a domain with a trust relationship to that domain.
segment.target: This error can indicate that the network share is outside the user’s domain or a domain with a trust relationship to that domain.

segment.source: To check for operational log events, open the Event Viewer and navigate to Applications and Services LogsMicrosoftUser Experience VirtualizationLoggingOperational.
segment.target: To check for operational log events, open the Event Viewer and navigate to Applications and Services LogsMicrosoftUser Experience VirtualizationLoggingOperational.

segment.source: Network shares that are used for UE-V settings storage locations should reside in the same Active Directory domain as the user or a trusted domain of the user’s domain.
segment.target: Network shares that are used for UE-V settings storage locations should reside in the same Active Directory domain as the user or a trusted domain of the user’s domain.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Use network shares from the same Active Directory domain as the user.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Use network shares from the same Active Directory domain as the user.

segment.source: Unpredictable results with both Office 2010 and Office 2013 installed
segment.target: Unpredictable results with both Office 2010 and Office 2013 installed

segment.source: When a user has both Office 2010 and Office 2013 installed, any common settings between the two versions of Office are roamed by UE-V.
segment.target: When a user has both Office 2010 and Office 2013 installed, any common settings between the two versions of Office are roamed by UE-V.

segment.source: This could cause the Office 2010 package size to be quite large or result in unpredictable conflicts with 2013, particularly if Office 365 is used.
segment.target: This could cause the Office 2010 package size to be quite large or result in unpredictable conflicts with 2013, particularly if Office 365 is used.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Install only one version of Office or limit which settings are synchronized by UE-V.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Install only one version of Office or limit which settings are synchronized by UE-V.

segment.source: Uninstall and re-install of Windows 8 app reverts settings to initial state
segment.target: Uninstall and re-install of Windows 8 app reverts settings to initial state

segment.source: While using UE-V settings synchronization for a Windows 8 app, if the user uninstalls the app and then reinstalls the app, the app’s settings revert to their default values.
segment.target: While using UE-V settings synchronization for a Windows 8 app, if the user uninstalls the app and then reinstalls the app, the app’s settings revert to their default values.

segment.source: This happens because the uninstall removes the local (cached) copy of the app’s settings but does not remove the local UE-V settings package.
segment.target: This happens because the uninstall removes the local (cached) copy of the app’s settings but does not remove the local UE-V settings package.

segment.source: When the app is reinstalled and launched, UE-V gather the app settings that were reset to the app defaults and then uploads the default settings to the central storage location.
segment.target: When the app is reinstalled and launched, UE-V gather the app settings that were reset to the app defaults and then uploads the default settings to the central storage location.

segment.source: Other computers running the app then download the default settings.
segment.target: Other computers running the app then download the default settings.

segment.source: This behavior is identical to the behavior of desktop applications.
segment.target: This behavior is identical to the behavior of desktop applications.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: None.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: None.

segment.source: Email signature roaming for Outlook 2010
segment.target: Email signature roaming for Outlook 2010

segment.source: UE-V will roam the Outlook 2010 signature files between devices.
segment.target: UE-V will roam the Outlook 2010 signature files between devices.

segment.source: However, the default signature options for new messages and replies or forwards are not synchronized.
segment.target: However, the default signature options for new messages and replies or forwards are not synchronized.

segment.source: These two settings are stored in the Outlook profile, which UE-V does not roam.
segment.target: These two settings are stored in the Outlook profile, which UE-V does not roam.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: None.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: None.

segment.source: UE-V does not support roaming settings between 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Microsoft Office
segment.target: UE-V does not support roaming settings between 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Microsoft Office

segment.source: We recommend that you install the 32-bit version of Microsoft Office for both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.
segment.target: We recommend that you install the 32-bit version of Microsoft Office for both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.

segment.source: To choose the Microsoft Office version that you need, click here.
segment.target: To choose the Microsoft Office version that you need, click here.

segment.source: (http://office.microsoft.com/word-help/choose-the-32-bit-or-64-bit-version-of-microsoft-office-HA010369476.aspx).
segment.target: (http://office.microsoft.com/word-help/choose-the-32-bit-or-64-bit-version-of-microsoft-office-HA010369476.aspx).

segment.source: UE-V supports roaming settings between identical architecture versions of Office.
segment.target: UE-V supports roaming settings between identical architecture versions of Office.

segment.source: For example, 32-bit Office settings will roam between all 32-bit Office instances.
segment.target: For example, 32-bit Office settings will roam between all 32-bit Office instances.

segment.source: UE-V does not support roaming settings between 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Office.
segment.target: UE-V does not support roaming settings between 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Office.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: None
segment.target: WORKAROUND: None

segment.source: MSI’s are not localized
segment.target: MSI’s are not localized

segment.source: UE-V 2.0 includes a localized setup program for both the UE-V Agent and UE-V generator.
segment.target: UE-V 2.0 includes a localized setup program for both the UE-V Agent and UE-V generator.

segment.source: These MSI files are still available but the user interface is minimized and the MSI’s only display in English.
segment.target: These MSI files are still available but the user interface is minimized and the MSI’s only display in English.

segment.source: Despite the file being in English, the setup program installs all supported languages during the installation.
segment.target: Despite the file being in English, the setup program installs all supported languages during the installation.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: None
segment.target: WORKAROUND: None

segment.source: Favicons that are associated with Internet Explorer 9 favorites do not roam
segment.target: Favicons that are associated with Internet Explorer 9 favorites do not roam

segment.source: The favicons that are associated with Internet Explorer 9 favorites are not roamed by User Experience Virtualization and do not appear when the favorites first appear on a new computer.
segment.target: The favicons that are associated with Internet Explorer 9 favorites are not roamed by User Experience Virtualization and do not appear when the favorites first appear on a new computer.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Favicons will appear with their associated favorites once the bookmark is used and cached in the Internet Explorer 9 browser.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Favicons will appear with their associated favorites once the bookmark is used and cached in the Internet Explorer 9 browser.

segment.source: File settings paths are stored in registry
segment.target: File settings paths are stored in registry

segment.source: Some application settings store the paths of their configuration and settings files as values in the registry.
segment.target: Some application settings store the paths of their configuration and settings files as values in the registry.

segment.source: The files that are referenced as paths in the registry must be synchronized when settings are roamed between computers.
segment.target: The files that are referenced as paths in the registry must be synchronized when settings are roamed between computers.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Use folder redirection or some other technology to ensure that any files that are referenced as file settings paths are present and placed in the same location on all computers where settings roam.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Use folder redirection or some other technology to ensure that any files that are referenced as file settings paths are present and placed in the same location on all computers where settings roam.

segment.source: Long Settings Storage Paths could cause an error
segment.target: Long Settings Storage Paths could cause an error

segment.source: Keep settings storage paths as short as possible.
segment.target: Keep settings storage paths as short as possible.

segment.source: Long paths could prevent resolution or synchronization.
segment.target: Long paths could prevent resolution or synchronization.

segment.source: UE-V uses the Settings storage path as part of the calculated path to store settings.
segment.target: UE-V uses the Settings storage path as part of the calculated path to store settings.

segment.source: That path is calculated in the following way: settings storage path + “settingspackages” + package dir (template ID) + package name (template ID) + .pkgx.
segment.target: That path is calculated in the following way: settings storage path + “settingspackages” + package dir (template ID) + package name (template ID) + .pkgx.

segment.source: If that calculated path exceeds 260 characters, package storage will fail and generate the following error message in the UE-V operational event log:
segment.target: If that calculated path exceeds 260 characters, package storage will fail and generate the following error message in the UE-V operational event log:

segment.source: To check the operational log events, open the Event Viewer and navigate to Applications and Services Logs / Microsoft / User Experience Virtualization / Logging / Operational.
segment.target: To check the operational log events, open the Event Viewer and navigate to Applications and Services Logs / Microsoft / User Experience Virtualization / Logging / Operational.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: None.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: None.

segment.source: Some operating system settings only roam between like operating system versions
segment.target: Some operating system settings only roam between like operating system versions

segment.source: Operating system settings for Narrator and currency characters specific to the locale (i.e. language and regional settings) will only roam across like operating system versions of Windows.
segment.target: Operating system settings for Narrator and currency characters specific to the locale (i.e. language and regional settings) will only roam across like operating system versions of Windows.

segment.source: For example, currency characters will not roam between Windows 7 and Windows 8.
segment.target: For example, currency characters will not roam between Windows 7 and Windows 8.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: None
segment.target: WORKAROUND: None

segment.source: Windows 8 apps do not sync settings when the app restarts after closing unexpectedly
segment.target: Windows 8 apps do not sync settings when the app restarts after closing unexpectedly

segment.source: If a Windows 8 app closes unexpectedly soon after startup, settings for the application may not be synchronized when the application is restarted.
segment.target: If a Windows 8 app closes unexpectedly soon after startup, settings for the application may not be synchronized when the application is restarted.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Close the Windows 8 app, close and restart the UevAppMonitor.exe application (can use TaskManager), and then restart the Windows 8 app.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Close the Windows 8 app, close and restart the UevAppMonitor.exe application (can use TaskManager), and then restart the Windows 8 app.

segment.source: UE-V 1 agent generates errors when running UE-V 2 templates
segment.target: UE-V 1 agent generates errors when running UE-V 2 templates

segment.source: If a UE-V 2 settings location template is distributed to a computer installed with a UE-V 1 agent, some settings fail to synchronize between computers and the agent reports errors in the event log.
segment.target: If a UE-V 2 settings location template is distributed to a computer installed with a UE-V 1 agent, some settings fail to synchronize between computers and the agent reports errors in the event log.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: When migrating from UE-V 1 to UE-V 2 and it is likely you’ll have computers running the previous version of the agent, create a separate UE-V 2.0 catalog to support the UE-V 2.0 Agent and templates.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: When migrating from UE-V 1 to UE-V 2 and it is likely you’ll have computers running the previous version of the agent, create a separate UE-V 2.0 catalog to support the UE-V 2.0 Agent and templates.
